channel.title: Recent & Upcoming Talks on Home
channel.description: Recent content in Recent & Upcoming Talks on Home

item.title: ADaptive Empirical Pattern Transformation (ADEPT) with application to walking stride segmentation
Wearable accelerometers, accelerometry data and automatic steps segmentation in R: strideter and convo R packages
Novel approach for precise walking cadence estimation from high-density tri-axial accelerometry data collected at wrist in free-living
Precise walking strides segmentation from raw accelerometry data: ADEPT method
Automatic estimation of step asymmetry in a split-belt treadmill experiment using high-resolution accelerometry data
Considerations in statistical modeling of walking features derived from wrist-worn sensor in free-living
Functional registration of walking strides in high-density accelerometry data for estimation of gait asymmetry
Methods for fast processing of time-series: runstats R package
Overview of JHU Biostat Wearable and Implantable Technology (WIT) working group research

Physical activity monitoring with wearable accelerometers: strides segmentation, gait pattern estimation and walking detection from free-living data in R. Also: highlights from RStudio 2019 conference.
item.description: Slides from the talk part about RStudio 2019 conference can be found here.

item.title: Simulation experiment project for Seminar on Adaptive Clinical Trials
Some of the topics seen at RStudio conference 2019
item.description: Ben’s tweet thread with some pics from the talk: [link]

item.title: Stride segmentation and stride pattern estimation based on accelerometry data
item.description: Some picture from the talk was posted here.

item.title: Towards precise walking strides segmentation from accelerometry data in free-living: ADEPT method and further developments
Walking measurements derived from free-living wrist-worn sensor as novel digital endpoints
